rules.natural: If evacuation is ordered for the production facility, then emergency response is not activated for incident coordination.
Provided that risk assessment is complete for hazard analysis, regulatory approval is granted for chemical operations.
Either risk assessment is complete for hazard analysis or safety audit is scheduled for quarterly review.
Provided that compliance check passes for material handling, regulatory approval is granted for chemical operations.
Under the condition that incident investigation is initiated for safety breach, investigation report is submitted to regulatory agency.
Provided that root cause is identified for equipment failure, corrective action is implemented for process improvement.
If investigation report is submitted to regulatory agency, then root cause is identified for equipment failure.
Whenever alcohol concentration exceeds the limit, ethanol production requires approval.
Under the condition that new guidelines are implemented in the safety manual, if training session is scheduled for handling procedures, then safety protocol is updated for chemical storage.
Either new guidelines are implemented in the safety manual or procedure revision is completed for operating instructions.
Provided that procedure revision is completed for operating instructions, if training session is scheduled for handling procedures, then safety protocol is updated for chemical storage.
If disposal restriction is imposed for hazardous material, then disposal permit is not granted for waste management.

Either regulatory waiver is granted for temporary exception, or if it is not the case that not granting regulatory approval for chemical operations implies not requiring environmental impact assessment for disposal process, and this leads to disposal restriction being imposed for hazardous material, then alternative disposal method is approved for recycling process.
If compliance deadline is extended for implementation period, then regulatory waiver is not granted for temporary exception.
Provided that additional funding is approved for safety upgrade, compliance deadline is extended for implementation period.
Either additional funding is approved for safety upgrade or implementation timeline is adjusted for upgrade schedule.
Whenever implementation timeline is adjusted for upgrade schedule, compliance deadline is extended for implementation period.
Either safety committee reviews incident report or external consultant is hired for safety analysis.
If external consultant is hired for safety analysis, then provided that incident investigation is initiated for safety breach, root cause is identified for equipment failure.
Provided that legal action is initiated for regulatory violation, fine is imposed by compliance authority.
If legal action is initiated for regulatory violation, then license is suspended for operating permit.
If criminal charges are filed for safety negligence, then civil penalty is assessed for regulatory breach.
Provided that criminal charges are filed for safety negligence, civil penalty is not assessed for regulatory breach.
Whenever transportation violates regulation, either chemical plant fails inspection or if regulatory approval is not granted for chemical operations, then alcohol concentration exceeds the limit.
Either transportation violates regulation or production line requires shutdown.
If certification is maintained for safety standard, then regulatory approval is granted for chemical operations.
Either maintenance is overdue for equipment inspection or if safety audit is scheduled for quarterly review, then certification is maintained for safety standard.
If corrective measures are documented for improvement plan, then incident documentation is completed for investigation file.
Provided that production line requires shutdown, either chemical plant fails inspection or if regulatory approval is not granted for chemical operations, then alcohol concentration exceeds the limit.
Whenever implementation timeline is established for correction schedule, corrective measures are documented for improvement plan.
If progress monitoring is initiated for implementation tracking, then implementation timeline is established for correction schedule.
Under the condition that material safety data is updated for chemical inventory, storage requirements are modified for chemical containment.
Either material safety data is updated for chemical inventory or if training session is scheduled for handling procedures, then safety protocol is updated for chemical storage.
If storage requirements are modified for chemical containment, then handling instructions are revised for safety data sheet.
Provided that emergency response plan is reviewed for evacuation procedure, drill simulation is conducted for emergency response.
Either emergency response plan is reviewed for evacuation procedure or if training session is scheduled for handling procedures, then safety protocol is updated for chemical storage.
Either response team is trained for emergency procedures or equipment is inspected for emergency systems.
Whenever equipment is inspected for emergency systems, if emergency response plan is reviewed for evacuation procedure, then drill simulation is not conducted for emergency response.
If ethanol storage has a leak, then regulatory approval is granted for chemical operations.
Either ethanol storage has a leak or distillation unit experiences equipment malfunction.
Under the condition that drill coordinator is assigned to training supervisor, if safety drill is scheduled for quarterly exercise, then emergency drill does not fail for response evaluation.
Either drill coordinator is assigned to training supervisor or external evaluator is hired for drill assessment.
Either drill certification is granted to response team or drill evaluation is not completed for performance review.
If pressure sensor triggers an alarm, then leak detection failure does not cause a spill.
If it is not the case that safety audit being scheduled for quarterly review implies compliance check passes for material handling, then incident investigation is initiated for safety breach.

Under the condition that it is not the case that safety audit being scheduled for quarterly review implies compliance check passes for material handling, corrective action is not implemented for process improvement.

If it is not the case that incident investigation being initiated for safety breach implies root cause is identified for equipment failure, then progress monitoring is initiated for implementation tracking.

If it is not the case that license being suspended for operating permit implies fine is not imposed by compliance authority, then criminal charges are filed for safety negligence.

Whenever it is not the case that maintenance audit being conducted for equipment review implies that if maintenance is overdue for equipment inspection then preventive maintenance is scheduled for equipment calibration, maintenance budget is approved for upgrade funding.
